metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0662 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In PHP 8.0.X before 8.0.28, 8.1.X before 8.1.16 and 8.2.X before 8.2.3, excessive number of parts in HTTP form upload can cause high resource consumption and excessive number of log entries. This can cause denial of service on the affected server by exhausting CPU resources or disk space.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0662` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.4 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.11
libapache2-mod-php8.0 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.11
libapache2-mod-php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.11
libphp8.1-embed - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.11
php8.1 - 8.1.2-1ubuntu2.11

criterions.comment: php8.1 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1.2-1ubuntu2.11').
